greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into 3 distinct nonzero squares.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
formula: a(n)>0  <=>  n is in A004432. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 03 2013
a(n) = [x^n y^3] Product_{k>=1} (1 + y*x^(k^2)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 22 2019
mathematica: b[n_, i_, t_] := b[n, i, t] = If[n==0, If[t==0, 1, 0], If[i<1 || t<1, 0, If[i==1, 0, b[n, i-1, t]] + If[i^2 > n, 0, b[n-i^2, i-1, t-1]]]]; a[n_] := b[n, Sqrt[n] // Floor, 3]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 120}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 10 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
